slam.map_manager.map_factories.lidar_map_factory module

class slam.map_manager.map_factories.lidar_map_factory.LidarMapFactory(config: LidarMapFactoryConfig)[source]

Bases: object

Factory for a lidar map.

__init__(config: LidarMapFactoryConfig) → None[source]
Parameters:

config – configuration of the factory.

property map: LidarMap

Lidar pointcloud map instance.

property vertices_types: tuple[type[Vertex], ...]

Required vertices types to create a lidar pointcloud map.

create(vertex_storage: VertexStorage, batch_factory: BatchFactory) → None[source]

Creates a lidar pointcloud map.

Parameters:

  • vertex_storage – storage of graph vertices.

  • batch_factory – factory to create a data batch.

_create_requests_table(vertex_storage: VertexStorage) → dict[LidarPose, set[Element]][source]

Creates “vertices -> elements” table.

Parameters:

vertex_storage – storage of graph vertices.

Returns:

“vertices -> elements” table.

static _get_elements(vertex_elements_table: dict[LidarPose, set[Element]], batch_factory: BatchFactory) → dict[LidarPose, deque[Element]][source]

Gets elements with raw lidar pointcloud measurements and assign to the corresponding vertices.

Parameters:

  • vertex_elements_table – “vertices -> elements” table. Elements do not contain raw lidar pointcloud measurements.

  • batch_factory (BatchFactory) – factory to create a batch.

Returns:

“vertices -> elements” table. Each element contains raw lidar pointcloud measurement.

static _create_vertex_measurements_table(vertex_edges_table: dict[LidarPose, set[Edge]]) → dict[LidarPose, list[Measurement]][source]

Creates “vertex -> measurements” table.

Parameters:

vertex_edges_table – “vertex -> edges” table.

Returns:

“vertex -> measurements” table.

static _get_unique_elements(measurements: Iterable[Measurement]) → set[Element][source]

Gets set of unique elements from the given collections of measurements.

Parameters:

measurements – collections of measurements.

Returns:

set of elements.

static _create_vertex_elements_table(vertex_measurements_table: dict[LidarPose, list[Measurement]]) → dict[LidarPose, set[Element]][source]

Creates “vertex -> elements” table.

Parameters:

vertex_measurements_table – “vertices -> measurements” table.

Returns:

“vertex -> elements” table.

static _values_to_array(values: tuple[float, ...], num_channels: int) → ndarray[source]

Converts values to pointcloud np.ndarray [num_channels, N].

Parameters:

values – values to convert.

Returns:

Values as array [num_channels, N].

static _filter_array(array: ndarray, lower_bound: float, upper_bound: float) → ndarray[source]

Filters 2D array [4, N] with lower/upper bounds. If a column has at least one value outside the bounds, the whole column is removed.

Parameters:

  • array – array [4, N] of points to filter.

  • lower_bound – lower bound value.

  • upper_bound – upper bound value.

Returns:

filtered array [4, K].

static _transform_pointcloud(tf1: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], tf2: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], pointcloud: ndarray) → ndarray[source]
Transforms points` coordinates to the global coordinate frame based

on the given vertex pose and transformation: base -> sensor.

Parameters:

  • tf1 – transformation matrix SE(3).

  • tf2 – transformation matrix SE(3).

  • pointcloud – pointcloud array [4, N] to transform.

Returns:

Transformed pointcloud array [4, N].

_build_pointcloud(pose: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], tf: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], values: tuple[float, ...]) → ndarray[source]

Builds a pointcloud from the given values and transforms it according to the vertex pose and base -> lidar transformation. Ignores intensity values.

Parameters:

  • pose – pose SE(3).

  • tf – base -> lidar transformation SE(3).

  • values – raw lidar pointcloud data.

Returns:

Pointcloud array [4, N].

_build_pointcloud_map(vertex_elements_table: dict[LidarPose, deque[Element]]) → ndarray[source]

Builds a pointcloud map from the given “vertex -> elements” table.

Parameters:

vertex_elements_table – “vertex -> elements” table.

Returns:

Pointcloud map array [N,3].

Raises:

TypeError – if the sensor is not of type Lidar3D.

Saves lidar pointcloud map to the file.

Parameters:

Raises:

ExternalModuleException – if failed to save the map using Open3D lib.

Loads the map.

Returns:

lidar pointcloud map instance.

Raises:

ExternalModuleException – if failed to load the map using Open3D lib.
